New in and children's reading ideas

Read your way to Christmas with our children's book advent calendar.

We stock thousands of children's books, both fiction and non-fiction. Here are some reviews, suggestions and lists of new books for children aged 0-11.

The Signalman by Charles Dickens"

Written by Matt Shenton · Published Oct 27, 2015

"Visited by an unnamed narrator, the signalman spends his days stuck in a dark, dank railway cutting that rarely sees light…"

George by Alex Gino

Written by Matt Shenton · Published Oct 26, 2015

A wonderful tale of an American transgender girl who dreams of playing Charlotte the spider in a school production of Charlotte’s Web.

Halloween for children 2015

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Oct 13, 2015

Halloween celebratory reads for little spooky skeletons.

Dyslexia Awareness Week 2015

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Oct 5, 2015

October 5-11 is Dyslexia Awareness Week. Picture books, joke books, poetry, and non-fiction can all help dyslexic children improve their literacy. Find out more about dyslexia.

New children’s books for October 2015

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Oct 1, 2015

Featuring Rob Biddulph, Nick Sharratt and Katherine Rundell.

National Coding Week 2015

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Sep 15, 2015

National Coding Week launches 21 September. Here are some great books to teach children how to program.

Starting playgroup and school in 2015

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Sep 3, 2015

Picture books and junior novels for starting or returning to playgroup and school.

New children’s books for September 2015

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Sep 1, 2015

Featuring Terry Pratchett and Louis Sachar.

Sawbones by Catherine Johnson

Written by Sophie Green · Published Aug 26, 2015

Woodbridge Library assistant manager Sophie Green reviews Sawbones, a historical thriller aimed at young teens.

YA fiction at Edinburgh International Book Festival 2015

Written by Emma Raindle · Published Aug 4, 2015

Edinburgh International Book Festival is the largest bookfest in the world, running 15-31 August 2015. Here are a selection of YA authors appearing at the festival.

More Children's books

  • Borrow a beautiful book with internationally-recognised illustrations
  • I Killed Father Christmas, by Anthony McGowan & Chris Riddell
  • Christmas Dinner of Souls, by Ross Montgomery
  • A Kitten Called Holly, by Helen Peters & Ellie Snowden
  • Horrid Henry's Christmas, by Francesca Simon & Tony Ross
  • Jingle Bells!, by Tracey Corderoy & Steven Lenton
  • Nadiya's Bake Me a Festive Story: thirty festive recipes and stories for children, by Nadiya Hussain & Clair Rossiter
  • Merry Christmas, Hugless Douglas, by David Melling
  • Lucy's Magical Surprise, by Anne Booth
  • New super-readable Barrington Stoke titles for December 2017 and January 2018
